msItem.author: Nicholas Trevet
msItem.title: Chronicles
msItem.incipit: (fol. 1b) Purce qe nous sumes auisez de ceux
msItem.explicit: Richard Roi dengleterte le filz Henry
msItem.note: Text begins on fol. 1a, breaking off unfinished in the first chapter, to begin afresh on fol. 1b. The chapter on Alexander the Great breaks off at the end of fol. 24v, beginning afresh on fol. 25. The chapter on Tiberius breaks off unfinished at fol. 37r, with part of 37r blank and 37v blank (not ruled), the ending of the text corresponding to MS. Rawl. B. 178, fol. 18v, which is the end of a quire. Fol. 38r begins mid-sentence in the chapter on Constantine, corresponding to the opening words of MS. Rawl. B. 178, fol. 36r. These correspondences seem to confirm the suggestion of an early owner, on a note pasted to the upper board, that the Douce manuscript was copied at least in part from the Rawlinson manuscript. The text breaks off presumably unfinished, fol. 69v, in the chapter for 1183. Fol. 70r-v blank (ruled).
Marginal headings as far as fol. 35r, thereafter added by a later hand.

supportDesc.collation: Often uncertain; leaves were rearranged by Douce. A tentative collation is: 1(8)-4(8) (fols. 1a-31), 5 (six leaves, fols. 32–37), 6(8)-7(8) (fols. 38–53), 8 (six leaves, fols. 54–59), 9 (six leaves, fols. 60–65), 10 (five leaves, fols. 66–70). Catchwords fols. 23, 45, 53, 59

layoutDesc.layout: Written space 170–80 120 Ruled in leadpoint, occasionally with ruling for running-heads at top and bottom. c. 36–42 long lines, varying in different sections of the manuscript, as follows: fols. 1b-7: 42 lines, written above top line; fols. 8–24: 37 lines, written above top line; fols. 25–31: 36 lines, written below top line; fols. 32–37: 37 lines, written above top line; fols. 38–45: 37 lines, written mostly above top line; fols. 46–53: 39 lines, written above top line; fols. 54–65: 36–40 lines, written above top line; fols. 66–69: 38–9 lines, written above top line.

handDesc.handNote: Secretary with some anglicana forms, probably by one rather variable scribe.

decoDesc.decoNote: Spaces for initials left blank; spaces for rubrication left blank; space for geneaological diagram (?) left blank.

binding.p: Seventeenth-century with armorial gilt decoration (see provenance)

history.provenance: Mr Harman, Katrin Harman, 16th century, fol. 1a recto: unidentified.

Quo quid antiquius eo melius
G: Buggyn, fol. 1a recto: probably William Buggin (d. 1618) (see Quarto catalogue of Laudian Manuscripts, p. xiii).
Ley family (arms on the binding, as baronets): probably Sir James Ley (baronet 1619, d. 1629)
Edward Umfreville (d. 1786, see ODNB) (note by him, pasted to upper board)
Francis Douce, 1757–1834: bookplate on upper board, and note by him

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford, November 2019. Previously described in the Summary Catalogue (1897). Summary Catalogue, vol. 4, p. 527 Summary Catalogue, vol. 4, p. 528

ref.title: JONAS: Répertoire des textes et des manuscrits médiévaux d'oc et d'oïl

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for publication on Digital Bodleian.
